text: today is the first day of school since
the earthquake in Haiti at st. Mary's a
private Catholic school in
port-au-prince the class won't be held
in the school's building it like
thousands of other schools around
port-au-prince was damaged in the
earthquake the one consolation is that
the earthquake struck late in the day
when most children were not in class but
some here didn't escape but those who
survived still have a thirst for
knowledge 600 students many of them
refugees from other damaged schools
arrived for classes at least 5,000
Haitian schools were damaged or
destroyed in the earthquake and hundreds
of instructors and thousands of children
were killed throwing an already fragile
educational system into disarray
now st. Mary's one of the city's only
open schools holds classes with
makeshift tents donated by the Dominican
Republic in the Israeli government or a
classes held on cement benches you're a
crypt where eight Haitian teachers who
